sentence.text: Fish splashed in small pools and the sweet scent of the river hurrying by charmed our days .
The smell of whisky mingled with the scent of jasmine growing against the house .
It was cold , silent in the room , the scent of the candles reminding him of the tomb beneath the earth at Tongjiang .
It was a magnificent evening , with the sun setting over the Atlantic in scarlet rags of cloud and the scent of thyme blowing off the land .
She lounges through the party rooms , a scent of snow as she passes .
She smelt the sweet scent of the gillyflowers .
The scent of tobacco was wafted up the stairs .
A strong scent of wine and onions wafted up from him : a tart , sickly smell that mixed with the heavy mustiness of the room .
Through the open windows of the room came the rich scent of summer flowers .
“ Cristo , ” he whispered , “ ah , the scent of your skin , cara , the taste of it … ”
Although it dies , the greenfly 's scent alerts its relatives to the danger , and they drop to the ground and escape .
The scout bee sometimes marks the food source with her scent .
Three-quarters were able to distinguish between the T-shirts and pick out the one with their body scent on .
A couple of logs lie on the hearth , drying , and the air smells of their pine scent and cigarette smoke .
Alex picked a bloom from the large bouquet of mixed carnations which stood to one side of her desk and held it to her nose , savouring the cinnamon scent .
But if the smell of your skin scent fails to make women swoon , there is hope .
The first one was a new one , and did n't have Sir Henry 's scent on it .
She was very conscious of the spicy scent from his skin , and a tremor ran through her .
The inhabitants were used to the smell , which mixed in nicely with the odours from Deller 's soap factory and the mingled scents from the river .
Hippopotamuses spread their scents by whisking their tails as they defecate , while white rhinos stamp in their faeces and then deposit the odour with each fragrant footstep .
The competition called for a first chapter of 2000 words to include a couple of phrases along the lines of ` the scent of freshly washed hair ++ "
There was the scent of freshly cut privet in the street , and Constance pulled a handful of petals from a neighbour 's falling rose as she passed .
The leaves are used in Middle Eastern and Greek cooking for their slightly spicy flavour and pungent scent .
Originally , she had sole claim to it but now everyone can buy this classic scent .
